00063 
00064   USyncClient::USyncClient(const std::string& host,
00065                            unsigned port,
00066                            size_t buflen,
00067                            const options& opts)
00068     // Be cautious not to start the UClient part of this USyncClient
00069     // before the completion of "this".  If you do (e.g., you forget
00070     // to pass "start(false)" to UClient), then the UClient, as a
00071     // libport::Socket, is likely to receive messages that will be
00072     // bounced to USyncClient::onRead, as expected for virtual
00073     // functions.  Except that "this" is not a valid USyncClient, as
00074     // its members we not initialized.
00075     //
00076     // Therefore, start handling connection only in the body of the
00077     // ctor.
00078     : UClient(host, port, buflen,
00079               UClient::options()
00080                 .server(opts.server())
00081                 .asynchronous(opts.asynchronous())
00082                 .start(false))
00083     , sem_()
00084     , queueLock_()
00085     , message_(0)
00086     , syncLock_()
00087     , syncTag()
00088     , default_options_()
00089     , stopCallbackThread_(!opts.startCallbackThread())
00090     , cbThread(0)
00091     , connectCallback_(opts.connectCallback())
00092   {
00093     // Do not start if connectCallback_ is set, we were constructed by a
00094     // listening socket.
00095     if (!connectCallback_)
00096       start();
00097     if (error())
00098       return;
00099 
00100     if (opts.startCallbackThread())
00101       cbThread = libport::startThread(this, &USyncClient::callbackThread);
00102     if (!defaultClient)
00103       defaultClient = this;
00104 
00105     callbackSem_++;
00106   }
00107 
00108   USyncClient::~USyncClient()
00109   {
00110     // Notify of destruction
00111     wasDestroyed();
00112     // Close the socket
00113     close();
00114     // Wait for our message handler thread to terminate
00115     if (cbThread)
00116       joinCallbackThread_();
00117     // Wait for all asio async handlers to terminate
00118     waitForDestructionPermission();
00119   }
00120 
00121   void USyncClient::callbackThread()
00122   {
00123     callbackSem_--;
00124 
00125     while (true)
00126     {
00127       sem_--;
00128       if (stopCallbackThread_)
00129       {
00130         // The call to stopCallbackThread is
00131         // waiting on stopCallbackSem_.
00132         stopCallbackSem_++;
00133         return;
00134       }
00135       queueLock_.lock();
00136       if (queue.empty())
00137       {
00138         // Only explanation: processEvents from another thread stole our
00139         // message.
00140         sem_++; // Give back the token we took without popping a message.
00141         queueLock_.unlock();
00142         continue;
00143       }
00144       UMessage *m = queue.front();
00145       queue.pop_front();
00146       queueLock_.unlock();
00147       UAbstractClient::notifyCallbacks(*m);
00148       delete m;
00149     }
00150   }
00151 
00152   void USyncClient::stopCallbackThread()
00153   {
00154     if (stopCallbackThread_)
00155       return;
00156     stopCallbackThread_ = true;
00157     sem_++;
00158     // Unlock any pending syncGet.
00159     syncLock_++;
00160     // Wait until the callback thread is actually stopped to avoid both
00161     // processEvents and the callbackThread running at the same time.
00162     stopCallbackSem_--;
00163   }
00164 
00165   bool USyncClient::processEvents(libport::utime_t timeout)
00166   {
00167     bool res = false;
00168     libport::utime_t startTime = libport::utime();
00169     do // Always check at least once.
00170     {
00171       queueLock_.lock();
00172       if (queue.empty())
00173       {
00174         queueLock_.unlock();
00175         return res;
00176       }
00177       res = true;
00178       UMessage *m = queue.front();
00179       queue.pop_front();
00180       sem_--; // Will not block since queue was not empty.
00181       queueLock_.unlock();
00182       UAbstractClient::notifyCallbacks(*m);
00183       delete m;
00184     } while (timeout < 0 || libport::utime() - startTime <= timeout);
00185     return res;
00186   }
00187 
00188   int USyncClient::joinCallbackThread_()
00189   {
00190     stopCallbackThread();
00191     if (cbThread)
00192     {
00193       PTHREAD_RUN(pthread_join, cbThread, 0);
00194       cbThread = 0;
00195     }
00196     return 0;
00197   }
00198 
00199   void
00200   USyncClient::notifyCallbacks(const UMessage& msg)
00201   {
00202     queueLock_.lock();
00203     // If waiting for a tag, pass it to the user.
00204     if (!syncTag.empty() && syncTag == msg.tag)
00205     {
00206       message_ = new UMessage(msg);
00207       syncTag.clear();
00208       if (waitingFromPollThread_)
00209         libport::get_io_service().stop();
00210       else
00211         syncLock_++;
00212     }
00213     else
00214     {
00215       queue.push_back(new UMessage(msg));
00216       sem_++;
00217     }
00218     queueLock_.unlock();
00219   }
00220 
00221   UMessage*
00222   USyncClient::waitForTag(const std::string& tag, libport::utime_t useconds)
00223   {
00224     if (message_ || !syncTag.empty())
00225       throw std::runtime_error("Another waitForTag is already in progress");
00226     syncTag = tag;
00227     message_ = 0;
00228     waitingFromPollThread_ = libport::isPollThread();
00229     // Reset before releasing the lock, as other thread may call io.stop()
00230     if (waitingFromPollThread_)
00231       libport::get_io_service().reset();
00232     queueLock_.unlock();
00233     // syncTag is reset by the other thread.
00234     UMessage *res;
00235     if (waitingFromPollThread_)
00236       if (!useconds)
00237         libport::get_io_service().run();
00238       else
00239         libport::pollFor(useconds);
00240     else
00241       syncLock_.uget(useconds);
00242     res = message_;
00243     if (!res)
00244       GD_ERROR("Timed out");
00245     else if (res->type == MESSAGE_ERROR)
00246       GD_FERROR("Received error message: %s", *res);
00247     message_ = 0;
00248     syncTag.clear();
00249     return res;
00250   }

00252   namespace
00253   {
00257     static
00258     bool
00259     has_tag(const char* cp)
00260     {
00261       while (*cp == ' ')
00262         ++cp;
00263       while (isalpha(*cp))
00264         ++cp;
00265       while (*cp == ' ')
00266         ++cp;
00267       return *cp == ':' || *cp == '<';
00268     }
00269 
00272     static
00273     std::string
00274     make_tag(UAbstractClient& cl, const USyncClient::send_options& opt)
00275     {
00276       std::string res;
00277       if (opt.mtag_)
00278       {
00279         res = opt.mtag_;
00280         if (opt.mmod_)
00281           res += opt.mmod_;
00282       }
00283       else
00284         res = cl.fresh();
00285       return res;
00286     }
00287   }

00289   USyncClient::error_type
00290   USyncClient::onClose()
00291   {
00292     if (closed_)
00293       return 1;
00294 
00295     UClient::onClose();
00296 
00297     stopCallbackThread_ = true;
00298     callbackSem_++;
00299     sem_++;
00300     return 0;
00301   }
00302 
00303   UMessage*
00304   USyncClient::syncGet_(const char* format, va_list& arg,
00305                         const USyncClient::send_options& options)
00306   {
00307     const USyncClient::send_options& opt_used = getOptions(options);
00308     if (has_tag(format))
00309       return 0;
00310     sendBufferLock.lock();
00311     std::string tag = make_tag(*this, opt_used);
00312     pack("%s", compatibility::evaluate_in_channel_open
00313          (tag, kernelMajor()).c_str());
00314     rc = vpack(format, arg);
00315     if (rc < 0)
00316     {
00317       sendBufferLock.unlock();
00318       return 0;
00319     }
00320     pack("%s", compatibility::evaluate_in_channel_close
00321          (tag, kernelMajor()).c_str());
00322     queueLock_.lock();
00323     rc = effective_send(sendBuffer);
00324     sendBuffer[0] = 0;
00325     sendBufferLock.unlock();
00326     return waitForTag(opt_used.mtag_ ? opt_used.mtag_ : tag,
00327                       opt_used.timeout_);
00328   }
00329 
00330   UMessage*
00331   USyncClient::syncGet(const char* format, ...)
00332   {
00333     va_list arg;
00334     va_start(arg, format);
00335     UMessage* res = syncGet_(format, arg);
00336     va_end(arg);
00337     return res;
00338   }

00340   UMessage*
00341   USyncClient::syncGet(const std::string& msg)
00342   {
00343     // Yes, this is studid, as it will copy uselessly.  But that's the
00344     // only safe way to do it.  The interface should be redesigned,
00345     // without buffers actually.
00346     return syncGet("%s", msg.c_str());
00347   }

00385   int
00386   USyncClient::syncGetImage(const char* camera,
00387                             void* buffer, size_t& buffersize,
00388                             int format, int transmitFormat,
00389                             size_t& width, size_t& height,
00390                             libport::utime_t useconds)
00391   {
00392     int f = format == IMAGE_JPEG || transmitFormat == URBI_TRANSMIT_JPEG;
00393     if (kernelMajor_ < 2)
00394     // FIXME: required to ensure format change is applied
00395       send("%s.format = %d;\n"
00396            "noop;\n"
00397            "noop;\n", camera, f);
00398     else
00399       send(SYNCLINE_WRAP("%s.format = %d|;"), camera, f);
00400     UMessage *m = syncGet(useconds, "%s.val", camera);
00401     if (!m
00402         || m->type != MESSAGE_DATA
00403         || m->value->type != DATA_BINARY
00404         || m->value->binary->type != BINARY_IMAGE)
00405     {
00406       delete m;
00407       return 0;
00408     }
00409     width = m->value->binary->image.width;
00410     height = m->value->binary->image.height;
00411 
00412     size_t osize = buffersize;
00413     if (f == 1 && format != IMAGE_JPEG)
00414     {
00415       size_t w, h;
00416       //uncompress jpeg
00417       if (format == IMAGE_YCbCr)
00418         convertJPEGtoYCrCb((const byte*) m->value->binary->image.data,
00419                            m->value->binary->image.size, (byte**) &buffer,
00420                            buffersize, w, h);
00421       else
00422         convertJPEGtoRGB((const byte*) m->value->binary->image.data,
00423                          m->value->binary->image.size, (byte**) &buffer,
00424                          buffersize, w, h);
00425     }
00426     else if (format == IMAGE_RGB || format == IMAGE_PPM)
00427     {
00428       buffersize = std::min(m->value->binary->image.size,
00429                             static_cast<size_t> (buffersize));
00430       if (m->value->binary->image.imageFormat == IMAGE_YCbCr)
00431         convertYCrCbtoRGB((const byte*) m->value->binary->image.data,
00432                           buffersize, (byte*) buffer);
00433       else
00434         memcpy(buffer, m->value->binary->image.data, buffersize);
00435 
00436     }
00437     else
00438     {
00439       //jpeg jpeg, or ycrcb ycrcb
00440       buffersize = std::min(m->value->binary->image.size,
00441                             static_cast<size_t>(buffersize));
00442       memcpy(buffer, m->value->binary->image.data, buffersize);
00443     }
00444     if (format == IMAGE_PPM)
00445     {
00446       char p6h[20];
00447       sprintf(p6h, "P6\n%zu %zu\n255\n", width, height);
00448       size_t p6len = strlen(p6h);
00449       size_t mlen = osize > buffersize + p6len ? buffersize : osize - p6len;
00450       memmove((void *) (((long) buffer) + p6len), buffer, mlen);
00451       memcpy(buffer, p6h, p6len);
00452       buffersize += p6len;
00453     }
00454     delete m;
00455     return 1;
00456   }

00502   int
00503   USyncClient::syncGetSound(const char* device, int duration, USound& sound,
00504                             libport::utime_t useconds)
00505   {
00506     if (kernelMajor_ < 2)
00507       send("syncgetsound = BIN 0;\n"
00508            "loopsound: loop syncgetsound = syncgetsound + %s.val,\n"
00509            "{\n"
00510            "  sleep(%d);\n"
00511            "  stop loopsound;\n"
00512            "  noop;\n"
00513            "  noop;\n"
00514            "};\n",
00515            device, duration);
00516     else
00517       send(SYNCLINE_WRAP(
00518              "syncgetsound = BIN 0;\n"
00519              "loopsound: loop syncgetsound = syncgetsound + %s.val,\n"
00520              "{\n"
00521              "  sleep(%d);\n"
00522              "  loopsound.stop;\n"
00523              "};"), device, duration);
00524 
00525     UMessage* m = syncGet(useconds, "%s", "syncgetsound;");
00526     if (!m
00527         || m->type != MESSAGE_DATA
00528         || m->value->type != DATA_BINARY
00529         || m->value->binary->type != BINARY_SOUND)
00530     {
00531       delete m;
00532       return 0;
00533     }
00534     convert(m->value->binary->sound, sound);
00535     delete m;
00536     return 1;
00537   }
00538 
00539   int
00540   USyncClient::syncSend(const void* buffer, size_t length)
00541   {
00542     if (rc != 0)
00543       return -1;
00544     sendBufferLock.lock();
00545     int res = effectiveSend(buffer, length);
00546     sendBufferLock.unlock();
00547     return res;
00548   }
00549 
00550   void
00551   USyncClient::waitForKernelVersion(bool hasProcessingThread)
00552   {
00553     // Do not call kernelMajor() which precisely requires kernelMajor_
00554     // to be defined.
00555     while (kernelMajor_ < 0 && !error())
00556     {
00557       // Process events if we are the processing thread or if there is none.
00558       if (!hasProcessingThread || cbThread == pthread_self())
00559         processEvents();
00560       // Process the sockets if we are the asio worker thread.
00561       libport::Socket::sleep(100000);
00562     }
00563   }

00566   USyncClient::onConnect()
00567   {
00568     UClient::onConnect();
00569     if (connectCallback_)
00570       connectCallback_(this);
00571     connectCallback_ = 0;
00572   }

00587   static void destroySocket(libport::Socket* s)
00588   {
00589     s->destroy();

00592   libport::Socket*
00593   USyncClient::onAccept(connect_callback_type connectCallback,
00594                         size_t buflen,
00595                         bool startCallbackThread)
00596   {
00597     return new USyncClient("", 0, buflen,
00598                            USyncClient::options()
00599                            .startCallbackThread(startCallbackThread)
00600                            .connectCallback(connectCallback));
00601   }
00602 
00603   boost::shared_ptr<libport::Finally>
00604   USyncClient::listen(const std::string& host, const std::string& port,
00605                       boost::system::error_code& erc,
00606                       connect_callback_type connectCallback,
00607                       size_t buflen,
00608                       bool startCallbackThread)
00609   {
00610     libport::Socket* s = new libport::Socket;
00611     erc = s->listen(boost::bind(&onAccept, connectCallback, buflen,
00612                                 startCallbackThread),
00613                     host, port);
00614     if (erc)
00615       return boost::shared_ptr<libport::Finally>((libport::Finally*)0);
00616     boost::shared_ptr<libport::Finally> res(new libport::Finally);
00617     (*res) << boost::bind(&destroySocket, s);
00618     return res;
00619   }

00621   bool
00622   USyncClient::isCallbackThread() const
00623   {
00624     return pthread_self() == cbThread;
00625   }
